FURNACE ENGINEERS AND SPECIALIST FABRICATORS

Find out more

About us

Support you can rely on

ALMOR supports the requirements of the vacuum and atmosphere furnace heat treatment industry and other process sectors where high temperatures or corrosive environments are encountered.

The group has been formed to deliver the benefits of an “all round capability” by bringing together a number of complementary furnace engineering and alloy fabrication companies with histories going back to 1917.

Our multi skilled team of experienced engineers enables ALMOR to meet most heat treaters needs from the design and supply of new equipment through responsive service and support to process plant re-engineering.

ALMOR’s unique capability is relied upon daily by many blue chip companies, for whose requirements ALMOR continues to develop new products and services. 

Learn more

What we do

Nickel Alloy Fabrication

Wellman Furnaces Division 

Almor Furnaces & Ovens

Servicing & Aftercare

Products and services

    Nickel Alloy Fabrications

    Commercially pure nickel alloys are use for corrosion resistant applications, specifically caustic alkali concentration processes. Almor specialises in Nickel Alloys which can be used for Fittings, Pipe, Tube, Sheet, Bar and Flange applications. Almost all heat treatment methods used with nickel and the nickel alloys can be used either to soften them, such as annealing, or to increase their strength, such as age hardening

    Find out more

    Furnace Fabrications

    Almor designs and manufactures a wide range of alloy components for heat treatment applications at its Nottingham and Tipton facilities. Nottingham routinely manufactures large retorts/covers, muffles, radiant tubes and burner systems. During the design phase Almor will regularly work alongside the customer to optimize component life through the selection of materials, manufacturing methods and the incorporation of its experience of similar situations.

    Find out more

    Refractory 

    The Almor Group are able to offer heat-resistant refractory materials that constitute the linings for high-temperature furnaces, reactors and other processing units. Due to our in-house design and engineering strengths we offer a complete range of refractory capabilities from construction of a completely new furnace to: 

    Find out more

     

    FURNACES & OVENS

    Almor has more than 90 years experience in the design of electric furnaces and ovens gained through its furnace arm (Wild Barfield Est in 1917). Over this time an extensive range of proven “standard” designs have been developed and now incorporate the latest technology in atmosphere and furnace control systems. These include:

    Find out more

    Wellman Furnaces Division

    Wellman Furnaces (a division of the Almor Group) have the capability to design, build and supply a complete range of new furnaces for the thermal processing industry: 

    Find out more

    Process Controls

    Almor is a leading supplier of bespoke process control equipment to the heat treatment industry. We also manufacture skid mounted ignition panels for petrochem flare gas systems. For heat treaters we design and manufacture atmosphere control equipment 

    Find out more

    Vacuum Furnaces & Relines

    Almor's Vacuum reline facility is located at its West Midlands Tipton plant. This facility carries extensive stocks of CFC materials enabling Almor to respond to urgent, as well as planned, hot zone relines or repairs. Both carbon based and metallic hot zones are produced from this site.

    Find out more

    Site Services - Atmosphere

    Almor supports the ongoing requirements of heat treaters with a wide range of responsive and reliable services covering most makes and types of furnaces. These are delivered through our substantial and highly experienced in-house team of service engineers. In particular we can provide 24 hour breakdown service and preventative maintenance programmes. These are delivered through our substantial and highly experienced in-house team of service engineers.

    Find out more

    Site Services - Vacuum

    Almor supports vacuum furnace users with a wide range of services covering most makes of vacuum furnace.

    Our highly experienced service team provide: On site maintenance and service contracts including:- Routine services contracts and prompt emergency support

    Find out more

    Spares and Parts

    Almor recognises the need to respond promptly to customers’ breakdown requirements.  To meet these needs we carry a wide range of replacement parts in stock, many of which are made in house.

    Almor acquired the Wild Barfield company in 1998 and are still able to provide a complete service including design, build and a full range of spare parts.

    Find out more

     Our Brands
     

    The Almor Group has expanded since its incorporation acquiring brands such as Wild Barfield & Barlow Whitney, Marathon Process Controls, Heat Treat Services to the most recent acquisition of Wellman Furnaces in 2015.

    The Wellman Furnaces division also expanded through acquisition and today incorporates a number of well-known names in furnace building such as Incandescent Ltd, Birlec, British Furnaces, Gibbons, Metalectric, CGE (Consultant Gas Engineers).  All contributing to the Group's depth of technical expertise and knowledge of furnace manufacture and operation.

      

    Our partners



     

      

     

     

    Meet the Team

    Established in 1992, Almor’s 70 strong team is headed up by the owner and Managing Director, Chris Allum (Ph.D)

    Find out more

Delivering Excellence

Shoreham Port is one of the largest cargo handling Trust ports on the South Coast. With excellent stevedoring and storage facilities we help to supply South East England with imported materials.

Learn About Shoreham Port

Commercial Property

Our commercial property portfolio is the biggest in the Shoreham area. We have over 90 units to rent including office, warehouse and industrial buildings and open areas of land all conveniently located.

Learn About Shoreham Port

Conservation Action

We conserve 2.2 miles of coastline by maintaining 20 timber and rock groynes and by moving 27,000 tonnes of shingle every year to stop beach erosion.

Learn About Shoreham Port

Leisure Craft Facilities

Offering sheltered and secure moorings for leisure craft, slipway launching for small crafts and a full chandlery service, our Lady Bee Marina offers the best marine leisure facilities in the area.

Learn About Shoreham Port

Greener Energy

With a total of 2064 solar panels on various buildings around the Port we generate a substantial proportion of the energy we use to operate.

Learn About Shoreham Port

Open Communications

With our up-to-minute website, bi-annual newsletters, public meetings, port visits and a range of useful literature we work hard to keep in contact with all our stakeholders.

Learn About Shoreham Port

Lady Bee Enterprise Centre

Office space available to let now

Further details

Pack

Our vision is to become the preferred South Coast Port for short sea traffic, marine related projects and a landlord for specialist sites, whilst being at the heart of the community.

What we offer

A thriving commercial Port on the South Coast of England, our mission is to provide a first class service to our customers and to continue to develop our excellent infrastructure and facilities to meet their requirements, in a commercially economic and efficient way.

Our helpful and friendly staff offer a full Stevedoring Service with a state of the art Track-A-Pack stock control system, enabling our customers to handle their cargoes quickly and efficiently. We provide a full range of Marine Services including Hydrography and levelling, Dry Docking and Crew Changes as well as catering for Leisure and fishing users. In addition, the Port has an extensive Commercial Property Portfolio to let.  

Your Pictures

 

A fantastic shot at sunset, captured by one of our Dockworkers, Dean Hamilton.
